titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the American Federation of Teachers Local 200 Records
American Federation of Teachers Local 200 Records

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections, University of Washington Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Mark Carlson using MARC2EAD conversion 2010
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

change.item: Detailed inventories and descriptions entered by Crystal Clements; arrangement and scope/content notes updated.

repository.corpname: University of Washington Libraries Special Collections

did.unittitle: American Federation of Teachers, Local 200 Records

bioghist.p: Labor organization of teachers in Seattle public schools since 1927 .

Local 200 of American Federation of Teachers was chartered in 1921, a union of classroom teachers in Seattle. Local 200 contained several subgroups throughout its history, and the Seattle Teachers' Association and Seattle Federation of Teachers were very prominent rival organizations within the local during the late 1960s through the 1980s.

arrangement.p: Records are divided into four accessions based on when they were donated. Accession numbers are 1909-001, 1909-004, 1909-005, and 1909-006.
Accession 1909-001 is broken into eight series based on its intellectual contents. The accession ranges from 1927-1973.

p.emph: Series IV: General Correspondence and Meeting Minutes, 1954-1969.
Series VIII: Publications, Leaflets, and Member Petitions, 1946-1973.

arrangement.p: Accession 1909-004 is broken into nine series based on its intellectual contents. Series VI is further divided into ten subseries based on various subjects covered within the series. The accession ranges from 1943-1974.

p.emph: Series II: Grievances and Employer Relations, 1964-1971.
Subseries C: Central Area School Council and Community Control of Schools in Central and South Seattle, 1968-1971.
Subseries D: Desegregation and Racial Issues, 1967-1971.
Subseries E: Contract Negotiations and Teacher Benefits, 1950-1971.
Subseries F: King County Labor Council, 1968-1971.
Subseries G: Legislation and Political Action, 1955-1972.
Subseries H: Federations of Teachers from Other States, 1968-1970.
Series IX: Publications, Leaflets, and Elections Materials, 1947-1974.

arrangement.p: Accession 1909-005 is broken into eleven series based on its intellectual contents. The accession ranges from 1964-1982. Materials within each series remain in their original order.

Accession 1909-006 is broken into three record groups reflecting creating organizations. The first record group is broken into fourteen series based on its intellectual contents, and the second and third record groups contain no further subdivisions. The accession ranges from 1963-1979.

p.emph: Record Group 1: American Federation of Teachers Local 200, 1963-1979.
Record Group 2: American Federation of Teachers Local 200 Executive Board, 1969-1972.
Record Group 3: American Federation of Teachers Local 200: Seattle Minority Teachers Association, 1976.

scopecontent.p: Consult the scope and content information for each of the accessions listed below.

accessrestrict.p: Consult the access restrictions information for each of the accessions listed below.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights transferred to the University of Washington Libraries.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs from Accessions 1909-004, 1909-005, and 1909-006 have been removed from their original locations and placed in the American Federation of Teachers Local 200 Photograph Collection in the University of Washington Libraries' Special Collections Division.

American Federation of Teachers Local 200 Records

scopecontent.p: Records related to the activities of the American Federation of Teachers Local 200. Includes reports, grievances and employer relations, financial records, meeting minutes, correspondence, photographs and ephemera, subject files, and news clippings and publications.

accessrestrict.p: Open to all users, but access to portions of the papers restricted. Contact repository for details.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights transferred to the University of Washington Libraries.

American Federation of Teachers Local 200 records

scopecontent.p: Bulk of records reflect activities of the Seattle Federation of Teachers, a subgroup within the American Federation of Teachers Local 200. Records include correspondence, minutes, financial records, membership lists, publications, contract enforcement documents, convention papers, subject files, files on individual schools within the Seattle School District, and papers from various committees and subgroups within the Seattle Federation of Teachers between the years of 1964 and 1982.

accessrestrict.p: Open to all users, but access to portions of the papers restricted. Contact repository for details.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights transferred to the University of Washington Libraries.

American Federation of Teachers Local 200 records

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, minutes, press releases, strike files and related records; 1963-1979.

Accession includes files from the 1970s, when classroom discipline, race relations, and busing were important concerns. The Subject Series in Box 2 include records of the G. Sally Pangborn lawsuit regarding dismissal of a popular teacher.

accessrestrict.p: Open to all users, but access to portions of the papers restricted. Contact repository for details.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights transferred to the University of Washington Libraries.
